Experience Training Manager Intel Corporation January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Folsom, California I currently manage the Learning and Development team for the Software and Services Group at Intel Corporation. We deliver learning solutions focused on technical training, technical leadership development, as well as manager and leadership development to over 5,000 globally dispersed software engineers. Technical Training Program Manager Intel Corporation June 2012  –  December 2013  (1 year 7 months) Folsom, California Responsible for developing and executing technical training and technical leadership development strategy for over 5,000 globally-dispersed software engineers at Intel Corporation. 
 
In this role, I partnered with key stakeholders from various divisions to implement a blended learning approach with instructor-led and virtual training by internal subject matter experts, as well as external training vendors. In addition, I incorporated technical summits, web-based solutions and social learning solutions such as podcasts and blogging. Learning Technologist - Visual & Parallel Computing Group Intel Corporation September 2008  –  May 2012  (3 years 9 months) Folsom, California Responsible for Technical Training, Technical Leadership Development and Technical Events for 3,500 globally dispersed team of visual & parallel computing engineers. 
 
In this role, I develop the strategy and implement appropriate learning interventions such as instructor-led training by internal subject matter experts, vendor-led training solutions, technical summits, video and web-based solutions, as well as social learning solutions. Training Account Manager - Mobility Group Intel Corporation October 2006  –  September 2008  (2 years) Folsom, California Developed Training Strategy and Programs, including new hire integration and technical training programs in the areas of Graphics Engineering, I/O and Chipset Training. 
 
Develop appropriate learning interventions such as instructor-led training, vendor training, eLearning or podcasting solutions. Recruiting, New Hire Integration & Training Program Manager - Software Engineering Group Intel Corporation February 2004  –  September 2006  (2 years 8 months) Folsom, California Developed recruiting strategy for Interns, Recent College Graduates and Experienced software engineering candidates. 
Managed and coordinated recruitment efforts at College and Industry events. 
Developed new hire integration strategy and programs 
Established technical training strategy and programs, including internal technical training and external vendor training for software engineers. Experience Implementation Lead and Account Manager Fulfillment Corporation of America, a Source Logistics Company March 2013  – Present (2 years 6 months) Beaverton, OR Implementation Lead: 
Responsible for executing implementation process of new clients and existing clients with new programs. 
	Manage internal and customer expectations based on joint established timelines and Statement of Work 
	Liaison between client and internal groups – Management, IT, Operations teams 
	Created project documentation to streamline implementation of new clients 
	Track all communications and provide regular updates to internal teams 
	Responsible for every set-up detail within IT, Fulfillment, Warehouse and Customer Service teams 
 
Account Management: 
Responsible for two of the top three clients, including national accounts, for all aspects of account management. Also supports multiple smaller accounts. 
	Primary liaison for internal groups and clients, ensuring both party’s real-time needs communicated and met: IT, digital, fulfillment, warehouse 
	Initiated profitability analysis of clients, comparing labor hours against contract 
	Generated training proposal for senior management to design a company-wide training program, emphasizing functional cross training within and across departments 
	Generated proposal for senior management to assign a dedicated resource to manage the implementation process for new clients  
	Generates monthly invoices for all accounts owned, supports other account managers in billing as necessary 
 Sales & Logistics SolarWorld February 2011  – Present (4 years 7 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Sold over 1/2 million dollars of solar materials in less than 3 months 
•Created & executed change for internal shipping communication  
•Documented processes within Logistics Department

•Responsible for all domestic shipments of solar modules

Product Training strategist and influencer for the newly formed group, the Communications & Embedded Silicon Sales Group (CESSG), which primarily consisted of new business acquisitions. 
	Conducted needs assessments with senior management and field to identify training gaps 
	Drove worldwide training steering committee consisting of senior management within sales, marketing, and product divisions to ensure successful immersion of newly acquired companies  
	Published training usage models (Best Known Methods) document and implemented worldwide 
	Program manager for core team planning CESSG’s first worldwide, face-to-face training events

	Executed merger and acquisition communications within SMG Learning Solutions

	Created 30-page roles and responsibilities document

Experience Brand Training Manager Intel Corporation July 2008  – Present (7 years 2 months) I have been working with Intel Corporation as a Brand Development and Training manager since 2008. 
I basically handle Dell accounts and ensure that all there EMEA segments established in Hyderabad sell Intel products. 
My role also includes selling and marketing of Intel products.Launching the new generation Intel cores every year on client and server products. 
I have been a key source to grow business for Intel from the Call Centre perspective. 
The group that I influence my sales is to more 250 Sales people in Call centre. 
I also ensure that the Relationship between Dell and Intel is maintained in a smooth fashion which in return ensures smooth business between both the partners. 
There are lots of road shows of products conducted every quarter which in return helps to grow the sales of various focussed products.
